header_summary:
The latest release of Bitcoin Core version 26.2 introduces significant improvements and bug fixes designed to enhance user experience and system efficiency, with the update now available for download at [Bitcoin Core](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-26.2/). This version features compatibility across multiple operating systems, including Windows, macOS, and Linux, and brings forward adjustments in script handling such as parsing TapMiniscript, alongside network and RPC enhancements. Users are encouraged to report any issues on GitHub and sign up for announcements via a mailing list, with a strong recommendation to follow specific installation instructions for a smooth upgrade process.

In the realm of cryptographic advancements, Ed Hughes has introduced an innovative logarithmic-size ring signature scheme, LS-LSAG, aimed at blockchain applications, which promises to significantly reduce signature size without sacrificing security or compatibility. This development, detailed in a draft available for community review at [https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/921](https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/921), leverages the Discrete Logarithm assumption to ensure unforgeability, emphasizing the ongoing quest for efficiency and security in blockchain technology.

Simultaneously, Tim Ruffing et al. are in the process of drafting a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) focused on Distributed Key Generation for FROST Threshold Signatures. This effort, aimed at gathering community feedback through a GitHub-hosted draft, covers design considerations, usage instructions, and a Python-based reference implementation, highlighting the collaborative effort to improve cryptographic practices within the Bitcoin ecosystem. This initiative, alongside a separate development of a BIP for FROST signing by other contributors, underscores the community's dedication to enhancing security and efficiency through continuous innovation.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 26.2 released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 26.2 is now available for download, featuring new improvements and bug fixes.
- Users upgrading from older versions should follow specific instructions based on their operating system.
- The release makes significant changes, including script adjustments and network enhancements.

recent_posts.title: A new logarithmic-size signature scheme LS-LSAG
recent_posts.summary:
- Ed Hughes introduced LS-LSAG, a log-size ring signature for blockchain improvement.
- LS-LSAG offers size efficiency and compatibility with Curve Trees in blockchain tech.
- It maintains key image compatibility and operates without trusted setup, enhancing security.

recent_posts.title: BIP Draft: "ChillDKG: Distributed Key Generation for FROST"
recent_posts.summary:
- Tim, Jonas, and Nick are drafting a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal for FROST signatures.
- Their draft includes design considerations, usage instructions, and a Python reference implementation.
- Feedback is sought on their GitHub-hosted project, with several development areas remaining.

active_posts.title: Idea for BIP : Deterministic Wallets with Token support
active_posts.summary:
- The increase in Ethereum tokens has outpaced wallet technology, compromising user privacy.
- A proposed solution involves creating unique keys for each token by modifying the HD wallet's HMAC function.
- This method enhances privacy, simplifies token management in wallets, and increases security against attackers.

active_posts.title: Public disclosure of 10 vulnerabilities affecting Bitcoin Core < 0.21.0
active_posts.summary:
- The project launched a new vulnerability disclosure policy to improve security.
- A schedule for public vulnerability disclosures starting with version 22.0 in July was announced.
- This transparency initiative aims to protect users and foster a secure community environment.

active_posts.title: BIP Authors: These BIPs could be Final
active_posts.summary:
- The email reviews Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs), suggesting updates to Final status.
- It covers enhancements in security, privacy, and efficiency across several BIPs.
- The sender invites BIP authors to update their proposals' statuses and review periodically.

active_posts.title: Is it time to increase the blocksize cap?
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights Bitcoin's scalability issues and its impracticality for daily use by low-income individuals.
- Concerns are raised about Bitcoin's base layer being potentially exclusive to elites, contradicting its decentralization ethos.
- The critique calls for Bitcoin's return to its roots as freedom money, opposing its current institutional alignment.

active_posts.title: Introduction to cluster linearization
active_posts.summary:
- Cluster linearization aims to enhance Bitcoin Core's efficiency by organizing transactions into clusters.
- It simplifies the process of block construction and transaction processing through optimized mempool management.
- Efforts are ongoing to integrate these advancements into Bitcoin Core to improve transaction handling and scalability.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin OP_CAT Use Cases Series #4: Recursive Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Recursive covenants broaden Bitcoin's applications by requiring conditions across bitcoins' lifecycle.
- Stateful smart contracts allow tracking and updating states across transactions, illustrated by a counter contract.
- Implementing these contracts on Bitcoin mirrors functionalities of platforms like Ethereum, with examples on GitHub.

today_in_history_posts.title: Covenant opcode proposal OP_CONSTRAINDESTINATION (an alternative to OP_CTV)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A new opcode, OP_CONSTRAINDESTINATION, limits output destinations for enhanced covenant scripts.
- It aims for more flexible wallet vaults than those made with OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY.
- Feedback is sought on the Github proposal to refine and address potential issues.

today_in_history_posts.title: Impact of eltoo loss of state
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bob's node crash leads to Alice and Carol dropping newer channel states on-chain.
- Carol can reveal point preimages via adaptor signatures; Bob cannot decode them for lost updates.
- Solutions include channel state sharing, mutual closes, and incentives for cooperative behavior post-crash.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies fall into passive or active categories, each with distinct management levels.
- Passive investments can lead to societal issues, like asset misalignment and underutilization, due to the principal/agent problem.
- The blog suggests central banks could stabilize economies by backing inflationary currencies with deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
